intro: Senecio oenequifolius, commonly known as the Narrow-leaf Senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a silvery or grayish underside, and it produces yellow flowers in late spring or early summer. Senecio oenequifolius is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appearance.
